abstract: The Supreme Court majority said that the group that brought the lawsuit was not cohesive enough to have suffered measurable, common damages.
snippet: The Supreme Court majority said that the group that brought the lawsuit was not cohesive enough to have suffered measurable, common damages.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Wednesday threw out a proposed class-action antitrust lawsuit against Comcast, the nation’s largest cable television company, in which a group of more than two million current and former Comcast subscribers sought to prove that the company had unfairly eliminated competition and overcharged customers.

headline.main: Court Rejects Antitrust Suit in Victory for Comcast
headline.print_headline: Court Rejects Antitrust Suit In Victory For Comcast
